decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Cathartic Reunion, and then bring creatures back from the graveyard like Prized Amalgam, Bloodghast, and Narcomoeba to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Darkblast to control the board. By constantly dredging and bringing creatures back, this deck aims to create an overwhelming board presence and win the game through a powerful and relentless combo strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of aggressive Human creatures supported by disruptive spells like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. The deck utilizes Aether Vial to efficiently put creatures into play and uses powerful cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up the team. By combining efficient creatures with disruptive elements like Reflector Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to flood the board with cheap artifact creatures and quickly buff them with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Inkmoth Nexus for infect damage and Galvanic Blast for extra reach. Karn, Scion of Urza provides card advantage and disruption while Etched Champion and Master of Etherium provide resilience and additional power. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy that can quickly close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a variety of human creatures. By playing efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish and Mantis Rider, alongside disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to control the game and deal damage quickly. The use of Aether Vial and creatures with abilities like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia's Lieutenant helps to make the deck more resilient and difficult to deal with for the opponent. The deck's mana base also ensures smooth color fixing for its diverse range of human creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly buffing up a hexproof creature with auras to create a powerful threat that is difficult for opponents to deal with. By giving the creature hexproof with cards like Leyline of Sanctity and Spirit Mantle, it becomes almost untouchable, while Ethereal Armor and Daybreak Coronet provide significant boosts to its power and toughness. The deck also includes some removal in the form of Path to Exile and relies on efficient card draw with Kor Spiritdancer to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on self-milling to fill the graveyard with large creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial. It aims to apply early pressure and control the game with efficient removal spells and counterspells. The use of cheap cantrips like Opt and Mishra's Bauble allows for card selection and synergy with delve creatures. Overall, the deck aims to win quickly through aggressive plays and efficient use of resources.

The main idea of this deck is to flood the board with Human creatures quickly and efficiently, using cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up the team. Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat help ramp up the creatures without worrying about mana colors, while cards like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan, utilizing the synergies within the Human tribe to secure victory.

The UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. By utilizing cards like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Detention Sphere, the deck aims to control the board state and win the game through powerful late-game threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes lands like Celestial Colonnade and Field of Ruin to maintain control over the battlefield while slowly grinding out the opponent's resources.

The main theme of this deck is to quickly generate mana using elves and cast powerful spells such as Collected Company and Chord of Calling to assemble a combo win condition. The strategy revolves around playing multiple elves with abilities that synergize well together, allowing for explosive turns where a large number of creatures can be put onto the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Ezuri, Renegade Leader and Shaman of the Pack, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an army of elves and deal lethal damage in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a variety of Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, along with powerful synergies like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter also disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Reflector Mage provide tempo advantage. Overall, this deck is focused on speed, synergy, and disruption to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with a combination of cheap and efficient Human creatures, utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to grow the team. Cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls help to accelerate the deployment of creatures, while disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter control the opponent's resources. The deck aims to apply pressure from the early turns of the game, overwhelming the opponent with a relentless stream of creatures backed by disruptive elements.

The key concept of this deck revolves around utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently drawing cards and controlling the board with counterspells, removal, and versatile threats. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command until it can leverage its powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Secure the Wastes to close out the game. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's three-color identity and provide consistent access to its key cards.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap, efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler, backed up by disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command while also generating value with cards like Faithless Looting and Lingering Souls. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Collective Brutality and Blood Moon allows for flexibility in dealing with a variety of threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It uses cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to search for these lands efficiently. The deck also includes powerful control elements such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Oblivion Stone to deal with threats and control the board. Additionally, the deck includes threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Thragtusk to close out the game once control has been established.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while slowly building up its own resources. Cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta provide card advantage and selection, while Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict deal with the opponent's threats. The mana base is built around Celestial Colonnade as a win condition, with Land disruption from Spreading Seas and Field of Ruin to slow down the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Farseek, Primeval Titan, and Scapeshift to quickly assemble lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and trigger its ability to deal large amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Wood Elves and Sakura-Tribe Elder to ramp up mana quickly, as well as cards like Sweltering Suns and Lightning Bolt for removal and control. The use of Prismatic Omen and Engineered Explosives can further increase the damage output and control of the deck.
